backend/main.mo: Defines the Ribbit canister with storage, access control, user data, posts, ponds, tags, likes, activity tracking, and related types.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries of numerous frontend files for reference.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point loading the React app with root div and main.tsx script.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Sets up TanStack Router routes and wraps the app with theme provider and toaster.
frontend/src/components/BookmarkButton.t: Bookmark toggle button using useBookmarks with customizable colors.
frontend/src/components/CommentItem.tsx: Renders a comment with avatar, metadata, content, and optional like/reply actions.
frontend/src/components/EmojiReactions.t: Emoji reaction bar supporting five emoji types with hover and selection states.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: Footer with navigation links and attribution to caffeine.ai.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Responsive header with search UI, create menu, mobile drawer trigger, and avatar loading.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Page layout with header, footer, and route outlet plus mobile sidebar drawer handling.
frontend/src/components/LeftSidebar.tsx: Renders the app's left sidebar with navigation links and recent activity items, highlighting the active route. Fetches recent activities and related lily data.
frontend/src/components/LilyCard.tsx: Displays a lily post with avatar, metadata, like/share actions, and optional tags. Fetches counts, pond data, and user avatar dynamically.
frontend/src/components/LilyImageFrame.t: Shows an image in a fixed aspect ratio, using a blurred backdrop if the image isn’t 4:3. Handles aspect ratio detection on load.
frontend/src/components/MobileLeftSideba: Provides a slide-in mobile drawer containing the LeftSidebar with a backdrop overlay. Disables body scrolling while open.
frontend/src/components/PondAboutSidebar: Displays detailed pond information, stats, moderators, and join/leave controls. Fetches pond data and handles membership actions.
frontend/src/components/PondCardJoinCont: Renders a join button for pond cards, handling join mutations and disabling when already joined. Provides toast feedback on success or failure.
frontend/src/components/PondMobileHeader: Shows mobile pond header with banner, profile image, description, and tab navigation for feed/about. Navigates to related routes on tab click.
frontend/src/components/PostCard.tsx: Displays a generic post with voting controls, metadata, content preview, optional image, and tag. Supports comment and view counts.
frontend/src/components/ProfileRibbitIte: Displays a user's ribbit with avatar, timestamp, related lily link, and a link to view the full conversation.
Provides a popover emoji picker that triggers a callback when an emoji is selected.
frontend/src/components/RibbitItem.tsx: Renders a ribbit with avatar, timestamp, like button, and threaded replies with optional reply form logic.
frontend/src/components/RibbitMiniBlurAv: Loads an avatar image with a tiny blurred placeholder and transitions to the final image once loaded.
frontend/src/components/RightSidebar.tsx: Shows trending ponds, popular tags, and recent popular lilies with loading states and basic sorting logic.
frontend/src/components/search/MobileSea: Mobile full-screen search modal showing trending searches or suggestions and handling input and selection events.
frontend/src/components/search/SearchDro: Renders a dropdown showing trending searches or live suggestions based on user input and triggers selection callbacks.
frontend/src/components/TagHubRightSideb: Displays top, trending, and newest tags using tag stats modules with loading and empty states.
frontend/src/components/UnderlineTabs.ts: Provides styled tab list and trigger components that apply underline-based tab styling.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages a backend actor tied to the user's identity and refreshes dependent queries when it changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useBookmarks.ts: Manages bookmarked lily IDs with localStorage persistence and provides helpers to toggle and query bookmarks.
frontend/src/hooks/useDebounce.ts: Returns a debounced value that updates after a delay when the input changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity authentication context, loading and managing identities via AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useMediaQuery.ts: Tracks whether a CSS media query matches and updates reactively.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for interacting with backend ponds, posts, and user-related actions using the actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines global Tailwind layers, theme variables, dark mode overrides, and utility classes for UI styling.
frontend/src/lib/formatNumber.ts: Formats large numbers into compact notation such as k, M, or B.
frontend/src/lib/imageCompression.ts: Handles client‑side image validation, resizing, and compression, skipping animated GIFs and adjusting formats based on transparency.
frontend/src/lib/pondNameValidation.ts: Provides alphanumeric pond-name validation, normalization, and user-friendly error messages.
frontend/src/lib/pondRank.ts: Sorts ponds by lily count, member count, and name, returning a map of ranks.
frontend/src/lib/shareLily.ts: Shares a lily URL using Web Share API with clipboard and textarea fallbacks and toast notifications.
frontend/src/lib/tagValidation.ts: Validates and normalizes alphanumeric tags and returns appropriate error messages.
frontend/src/lib/user.ts: Manages usernames, user IDs, and Froggy Phrase backup/restore logic using localStorage.
frontend/src/lib/viewCountCooldown.ts: Implements per-lily view count cooldown tracking via localStorage with check, record, and clear helpers.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with QueryClient and InternetIdentity providers.
frontend/src/pages/AboutPage.tsx: Displays the Ribbit about page with platform description, features, and community guidelines.
frontend/src/pages/AllPondsPage.tsx: Shows a list of all ponds with ranks, join controls, loading states, and navigation.
frontend/src/pages/CreateLilyPage.tsx: Provides a form to create a lily with text, image, or link content, including pond selection, tag suggestions, and image compression.
frontend/src/pages/CreatePondPage.tsx: Implements a pond creation form with name validation, description, optional images, and image compression handling.
frontend/src/pages/CreatePostPage.tsx: Allows users to create text, image, or link posts with pond selection, tag input, and optional image compression.
frontend/src/pages/FrogProfilePage.tsx: Displays a user's profile, avatar, posts, and comments with loading and not‑found states.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Shows the main lily feed with trending/new sorting, search support, and sidebars.
frontend/src/pages/LilyPage.tsx: Displays a single lily with ribbits, handles view count incrementing, sorting, commenting, liking, and image lightbox.
frontend/src/pages/PondAboutPage.tsx: Shows detailed information about a pond including moderators, visibility, and join/leave actions.
frontend/src/pages/PondPage.tsx: Renders a pond’s feed with its lilies, join controls, and mobile/desktop layouts.
frontend/src/pages/PostPage.tsx: Displays a single post with threaded ribbits, posting comments, and metadata like timestamp and pond link.
frontend/src/pages/SavedLiliesPage.tsx: Shows locally bookmarked lilies, loading each lily and allowing removal of missing or saved items.
frontend/src/pages/TagHubPage.tsx: Lists top, trending, and newest tags with stats and navigation to tag pages.
frontend/src/pages/TagPage.tsx: Renders a tag-specific feed showing lilies filtered by tag with sorting and automatic redirect to canonical tags, along with sidebars and loading states.
frontend/src/pages/UserSettingsPage.tsx: Implements user settings for username changes, avatar upload, Froggy Phrase management, pond membership management, and admin tools.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures TailwindCSS theme, colors, animations, and plugins for the frontend.
project_state.json: Defines the project state and requirements focused on fixing pond creation so only the creating user becomes a member.
